quote: Remember that you must die. But it is essential to understand that the key to a fulfilled life is to be mindful of mortality while focusing on what truly matters.
Death is the veil which those who live call life; They sleep, and it is lifted.
Memento Mori, remember that you are mortal.
Don't just live life. Remember to savor it.
Live each day as if it were your last, because one day you will be right.
Life is a constant dance of shadows and light; remember to embrace both.
The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.
Remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for.
Memento Mori is the reminder that our time is limited. Use it wisely.
Death is a stripping away of all that is not you. The secret of life is to 'die before you die' — and find that there is no death.
We all do not have a long life. Live what you believe, never fall into falsehood and vice.
We die only once, and for such a long time.
To practice death is to practice freedom. A man who has learned how to die has unlearned how to be a slave.
Death smiles at us all; all we can do is smile back.
Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
Life's most persistent and urgent question is, 'What are you doing for others?'
Mortality gives meaning to human life, while the awareness of death enhances life's value.
Life is too important to be taken seriously.
In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.
Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
Life is a journey that must be traveled no matter how bad the roads and accommodations.
Your time is limited, don't waste it living someone else's life.
In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
Life is made of ever so many partings welded together.
Life is trying things to see if they work.
Life is a progress, and not a station.

Life is full of surprises and serendipity. Being open to unexpected turns in the road is an important part of success. If you try to plan every step, you may miss those wonderful twists and turns. Just find your next adventure—do it well, enjoy it—and then, not now, think about what comes next.
